rationale: The hyperscribe output does not mention the patient's positive response to losartan or the absence of cough.
The hyperscribe output does not document the patient's report of dizziness when standing up quickly, only an instruction to stand up slowly.
The hyperscribe output includes an instruction to stand up slowly to avoid dizziness, which partially addresses management but lacks a comprehensive follow-up plan.
The hyperscribe output confirms the patient's adherence by noting losartan is taken every morning with breakfast.
The hyperscribe output does not include any information about the patient's exercise routine or its impact on blood pressure.
The hyperscribe output does not document any new or ongoing goals related to hypertension management.
